intro: Limonium aragonense var. ruizii, commonly known as the Aragon limonium, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is part of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The varietal form ruizii is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from the typical species.
